cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the central Gulf and aiming for the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north-northeast inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the Mouth of the Mississippi River/Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning from east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to the Alabama/Florida border (including Vermilion Bay, Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Mobile Bay); Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas to the Alabama coast, with greatest impact expected for southeast Louisiana and coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Major-hurricane winds possible; sustained winds 105 mph now with further strengthening to at least 120-140 mph near landfall. Hurricane-force winds could envelope the port for several hours Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening inundation of 10–15 ft possible from Morgan City to the Mouth of the Mississippi River, including the Plaquemines coastline and lower Mississippi River levee system.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals to 20 inches expected across southeast Louisiana producing flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged power outages; navigation channel shoaling and debris due to high river flow and surge.
